name: Susan Athey: Tech Economists & Causation
description: World of DaaS podcast. How she 'invented' the Tech Economist role at Microsoft. The difference between prediction and 'what if' questions.

name: Susan Athey: Tech Economists Wanted
description: AEA Research Highlights. Why companies like Airbnb need economists to solve marketplace design problems.

name: Susan Athey: Economics & AI
description: Stanford GSB Fireside Chat on the intersection of economics and artificial intelligence.

name: Susan Athey: Economics of Transformative AI
description: NBER lecture on how AI is transforming economic research and industry applications.

name: Steve Tadelis: Causal Inference in Tech
description: UC Berkeley / ex-eBay. Deep dive into causal inference methods used in tech companies.

name: Hal Varian: Googlenomics Q&A
description: AEI podcast. The 'Adam Smith of Googlenomics' on auction design and why productivity metrics fail in the digital age.

name: Hal Varian: Chief Economist at Google
description: Room for Discussion. Why every company needs a chief economist for forecasting, pricing, and market design.

name: Hal Varian: Doing Economics at Google
description: CEPR interview on search economics, ad auctions, and forecasting with Google Trends.

name: John List: Scale, Uber & The Voltage Effect
description: EconTalk. Former Chief Economist at Uber and Lyft shares war stories on field experiments and driver incentives.

name: John List: Scaling Proven Ideas
description: How to scale ideas at Uber, Lyft, and Walmart. Why most interventions fail when you try to grow them.

name: John List: Market Design in Ride-Sharing
description: How ride-sharing platforms design markets for drivers and riders. Insights from Uber and Lyft.

name: Kyle Kretschman: Economics at Spotify
description: Causal Inference Podcast. A rare look at a working tech economist role — running experimentation teams at a streaming giant.

name: Pat Bajari: Building Tech Economics at Amazon
description: Keystone interview. How Amazon's Chief Economist built tech-economics from scratch with 400+ PhD economists.

name: Preston McAfee: Auction Design & Tech Economics
description: Chief Economist at Yahoo, Google, Microsoft. Golden Goose Award winner. Deep interview on auction theory, ad markets, and mechanism design.

name: Sean Taylor: When Do We Need Causal Inference?
description: Former Lyft/Facebook DS lead. This talk saves you from over-engineering. Know when correlation is enough.

name: ML for Pricing & Auctions (ICML)
description: Design the mechanism, don't just bid in it. RegretNet and deep learning for auction design.

name: Ronny Kohavi: Experimentation Wisdom
description: The godfather of online experimentation. Decades of A/B testing wisdom from Microsoft and Amazon.

name: Alexey Stysin: Auction Mechanism Design
description: Data Science Tech Lead at Topsort, former Yandex. 7+ years building VCG auctions, ML for click prediction, and revenue optimization for search ads.

name: Nikhil Devanur: Lagrangian Duality in Mechanism Design
description: Microsoft Research. How to design revenue-maximizing auctions using duality — simple auctions, budget smoothing, and optimal mechanisms.

name: Casual Inference Podcast
description: Lucy D'Agostino McGowan & Ellie Murray. Highly technical discussions on A/B testing, DAGs, and causal methods.

name: EconTalk
description: Russ Roberts. The gold standard for long-form economic interviews. John List, Hal Varian, and more.

name: Not So Standard Deviations
description: Roger Peng and Hilary Parker on data science in the real world. Great for understanding the craft.

name: Freakonomics Radio
description: Economics applied to everything. Great for economic intuition and learning to communicate data insights.

name: Nathan Lambert
description: Interconnects. The primary chronicler of RLHF. For tech economists, RLHF is mechanism design applied to AI: eliciting preferences and training reward models.

name: Andrej Karpathy
description: Neural nets from scratch, LLMs as operating systems. Explains the intuition of optimization landscapes, not just how to write code.

name: Lilian Weng
description: Lil'Log. OpenAI Safety Systems lead. The single best technical summaries on DL, agents, and RL. Often cited as primary sources in papers.

name: Sebastian Raschka
description: Ahead of AI. PyTorch, LLM training, efficient finetuning (LoRA). Bridges academic papers and 'will this run on my GPU?' practicality.

name: Tor Lattimore
description: DeepMind. The definitive resource on bandit algorithms. Essential for pricing, dynamic allocation, and experimentation without losing money.
